CatDescriptText: Mrs. Martha LaPrade, 2546 Chauncey Drive, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 29, 1958, pg.2 with question: "Do people, whom you know, place more emphasis on social life than civic responsibilities?" answer reads: "Most of the people are out for a good time. They talk about civic responsibilities, about doing things for the youngsters, but they do not do too much about it."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Martha LaPrade, wearing light colored button down collared coat, gloves, multi colored floral head scarf, and dark circular patterned dress, holding dark handbag, standing in front of light colored marble wall, left store window displaying women's hats and handbags, right store window displaying men's shoes
